books.title: The Insidious Dr. Fu-Manchu
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: An intrepid detective hunts the criminal mastermind Fu-Manchu through early 20th-century London.

books.title: The First Sir Percy
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A man and his followers try again to overthrow the Stadtholder of the Netherlands.

books.title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
books.author: Frederick Douglass
books.summary: Frederick Douglass describes his youth as a slave in Maryland and his desire to be a free man.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Hindu Tales from the Sanskrit
books.author: S. M. Mitra
books.summary: Short stories and fables from the Sanskrit tradition.

books.title: Golf Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s golf stories featuring the Oldest Member.

books.title: Arms and the Man
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A humorous examination of human hypocrisy and war’s stupidity in the midst of the Serbo-Bulgarian war.

books.title: Zuni Folktales
books.author: Frank Hamilton Cushing
books.summary: A collection of folktales from the Zuni culture.

books.title: Fantômas
books.author: Pierre Souvestre
books.summary: A shapeshifting arch-villain terrorizes Parisian society.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: The complete U.S. public domain short fiction of horror legend H. P. Lovecraft.

books.title: My Disillusionment in Russia
books.author: Emma Goldman
books.summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

books.title: The Dain Curse
books.author: Dashiell Hammett
books.summary: A detective assigned to investigate a diamond theft finds himself entangled by a family curse.

books.title: Representative Men
books.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
books.summary: A collection of seven lectures by Ralph Waldo Emerson on great men and their role in society.

books.title: The Age of Reason
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: Paine argues against the legitimacy of the Bible and institutional religion.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: The Devil’s Dictionary
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A witty, sharp collection of sardonic word definitions from the 1800s and early 1900s that provide a snapshot into the irreverent humor of early American culture.

books.title: The Time Machine
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: A mysterious inventor travels to a land far off in time.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: O. Henry
books.summary: A collection of O. Henry short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: Two Years Before the Mast
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A Harvard student embarks on a two-year voyage as a sailor aboard a merchant ship, exposing the harsh conditions of life at sea in the 19th century.
